item.title: Introduction to combinations
item.description: In the area of combinatorics both combinations and permutations are central concepts. Both combinations and permutations relates to the selection of a number of elements from a set. What differentiates the concepts is whether the selection is ordered or not. In this post, I cover some fundamentals of what combinations are and how to count the number of combinations of sets. Definition Combinations are unordered selections of elements from a set.

item.title: Introduction to permutations
item.description: In the area of combinatorics both combinations and permutations are central concepts. Both combinations and permutations relates to the selection of a number of elements from a set. What differentiates the concepts is whether the selection is ordered or not. In this post, I cover some fundamentals of what permutations are and how to count the number of permutations of sets. Definition In contrast to combinations, permutations are ordered selections of elements from a set.
